alert.note: Alert for Nemaha; Pawnee; Richardson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 2:03AM CDT until April 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following counties, Nemaha, Pawnee and Richardson. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This rain is expected to fall over the same area that experienced heavy rain last evening. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Pawnee City, Humboldt, Table Rock, Summerfield, Stella, Shubert, Nemaha, Du Bois, Dawson, Kirkmans Cove Recreation Area, The Highway 62 and 105 Junction, Camp Cornhusker and Howe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
